  15. /* Need at least Windows Vista for WC_ERR_INVALID_CHARS */
  16. ‌#define _WIN32_WINNT 0x600
  17. ‌#define WINVER 0x600
  18. #include <windows.h>

  20. /* See corresponding values in runtime/win32.c */
  21. ‌static int windows_unicode_enabled = WINDOWS_UNICODE;
  22. ‌static int windows_unicode_strict = 1;

  24. /* Adapted from runtime/win32.c */
  25. ‌int caml_win32_wide_char_to_multi_byte(const wchar_t *s, int slen,
  26.                                        char *out, int outlen)
  27. {
  28.   int retcode;

  30.   if (slen == 0)
  31.     return 0;

  33.   if (windows_unicode_enabled != 0)
  34.     retcode =
  35.       WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8,
  36.                           windows_unicode_strict ? WC_ERR_INVALID_CHARS : 0,
  37.                           s, slen, out, outlen, NULL, NULL);
  38.   else
  39.     retcode =
  40.       WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, s, slen, out, outlen, NULL, NULL);

  42.   if (retcode == 0)
  43.     return -1;

  45.   return retcode;
  46. }

  48. ‌char* caml_stat_strdup_of_utf16(const wchar_t *s)
  49. {
  50.   char *out = NULL;
  51.   int retcode;

  53.   retcode = caml_win32_wide_char_to_multi_byte(s, -1, NULL, 0);
  54.   if (retcode >= 0) {
  55.     out = (char *)malloc(retcode);
  56.     caml_win32_wide_char_to_multi_byte(s, -1, out, retcode);
  57.   }

  59.   return out;
  60. }
